name: Amsterdam Corporate Group Portraits
description: Dataset based on the dissertation of Norbert Middelkoop: 'Schutters, gildebroeders, regenten en regentessen: Het Amsterdamse corporatiestuk 1525-1850' (2019).

name: Occasional Poetry
description: Dataset with occasional poetry (=Gelegenheidsgedichten) published in the Dutch Republic between c. 1600-1800.

name: STCN
description: Short Title Catalogue of the Netherlands

name: Wikidata
description: Data on almost anything and a hub to data elsewhere

name: ONSTAGE
description: The repertoire, performances, popularity and revenues of the cultural program in Amsterdam’s public theatre during the period 1637 - 1772.

name: ECARTICO
description: Over 55.000 artists and their connections in 17th-century Amsterdam

name: Rijksmuseum
description: Artworks and lots of objects related to the history of Amsterdam

name: Notary Network
description: RDF version of the Notary Network (Notarissennetwerk, https://notarissennetwerk.nl/), a structured version of the Repertorium van Notarissen.

name: Het Schrijverskabinet
description: The Panpoëticon Batavûm is a collection of small portraits of Dutch poets (and writers in general).
